    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(android.app.Application application)
        Initializes Sempro without settings. Use this only if you intend to call init(Application, Settings, SemproCallback) outside of an Application class

        This may only be called from Application.onCreate().

        Parameters:
        application - The Application

      • init

        public static void init(android.app.Application application,
                        Settings settings,
                        SemproCallback callback)
        Initialize the Sempro SDK with the provided settings.

        This may only be called from Application.onCreate(), unless init(Application) was called there.

        Use Sempro.getSettings() to retrieve and modify the given settings object.

        Parameters:
        application - The Application
        settings - The Settings to use
        callback - An optional SemproCallback instance to be notified of the result. Call SemproCallback.Response.getData() to check the InitializationStatus
        See Also:
        Settings, SemproCallback, SemproCallback.Response, InitializationStatus

      • login

        public static void login(java.lang.String userId,
                         java.lang.String jwt,
                         SemproCallback callback)
        Logs in a new Sempro user.

        You can either use this method to transition from logged out state to logged in, refresh the token of the existing logged in user or to switch the currently logged in user to a different one. You may not call login while the conversation screen is shown unless it is being called for the user already logged in. Doing so will result in a no-op. init(Application, Settings, SemproCallback) must have been called prior to calling login.

        Parameters:
        userId - The distinct id of the user to login. Must not be null.
        jwt - jwt used to prove the origin of the login request. Must not be null.
        callback - An optional SemproCallback instance to be notified of the result. Call SemproCallback.Response.getData() to check the LoginResult
        See Also:
        SemproCallback, SemproCallback.Response, LoginResult

      • logout

        public static void logout(SemproCallback callback)
        Logs out the current user.

        Calling this method while in anonymous state has no effect. You may not call logout while the conversation screen is shown. Doing so will result in a no-op.

        Parameters:
        callback - An optional SemproCallback instance to be notified of the result. Call SemproCallback.Response.getData() to check the LogoutResult
        See Also:
        SemproCallback, SemproCallback.Response, LogoutResult

      • startConversation

        public static void startConversation(SemproCallback callback)
        Force-start a conversation for the current user

        Creates a user and conversation on the server, allowing the business to reach out proactively to the user via the public API.

        It is strongly recommended to only call this method in the case where a message is likely to be sent.

        This method is called automatically when starting a conversation via the Conversation.sendMessage(Message) or Conversation.uploadImage(Message, SemproCallback) methods, or when a user sends a message via the conversation activity.

        If a conversation already exists for the current user, this call is a no-op.

        Parameters:
        callback - An optional SemproCallback instance to be notified of the result.
        See Also:
        SemproCallback, SemproCallback.Response

      • loadConversation

        public static void loadConversation(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                    SemproCallback callback)
        Loads a conversation by its ID and sets it as the active conversation for the current session.

        When called, subscribes the current device for push notifications on the passed conversationId, and sets the SDK to send and receive messages for that conversation going forward. Does not unsubscribe for notification on previously loaded conversations.

        If the conversation is already set to the passed id, this call is a no-op.

        Parameters:
        conversationId - The conversationId to set.
        callback - An optional SemproCallback instance to be notified of the result.
        See Also:
        SemproCallback, SemproCallback.Response

      • destroy

        public static void destroy()
        Terminate the Sempro facilities.

        Sempro is automatically terminated when the application exits. This method does not, usually, have to be called manually.

      • getSettings

        public static Settings getSettings()
        Accessor method for the SDK settings.

        Use this object to update settings at run time. Note: Some settings may only be configured at init time. See the Settings class reference for more information.

        Returns:
        Settings object passed in init(Application, Settings, SemproCallback), or null if Sempro hasn't been initialized yet.
        See Also:
        Settings

      • getConversation

        public static Conversation getConversation()
        Accessor method for the current conversation.
        Returns:
        Current conversation, or null if Sempro.init() hasn't been called yet.
        See Also:
        Conversation

        public static Config getConfig()
        Accessor method for the currently connected app configuration.
        Returns:
        Current app configuration, or null if Sempro.init() hasn't been called yet.
        See Also:
        Config

      • setFirebaseCloudMessagingToken

        public static void setFirebaseCloudMessagingToken(java.lang.String token)
        Method used to register the Firebase Cloud Messaging token to Sempro
        Parameters:
        token - The Firebase Cloud Messaging token

      • setFirebaseCloudMessagingToken

        public static void setFirebaseCloudMessagingToken(java.lang.String token,
                                                  SemproCallback callback)
        Method used to register the Firebase Cloud Messaging token to Sempro
        Parameters:
        token - The Firebase Cloud Messaging token
        callback - The callback to be called when token is received by Sempro
